content.text:
<task>
Investigate why the auto-commit rule is not triggering or failing.

1.  Read the content of `.kilocode/rules/auto-commit.md` to ensure the instructions for the AI are clear.
2.  Read the content of `.githooks/pre-commit` and `.githooks/commit-msg` to check for syntax errors or logic issues.
3.  Check the file permissions of the hooks in `.githooks` (they must be executable).
4.  Check the current git configuration to verify if `core.hooksPath` is correctly set to `.githooks`.

Report your findings and any issues discovered.
</task>

<environment_details>

[Memory Bank: Active] I'll investigate the auto-commit rule issue by examining the hook files, permissions, and git configuration. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the current setup.

<read_file>
<args>
  <file>
    <path>.kilocode/rules/auto-commit.md</path>
  </file>
  <file>
    <path>.githooks/pre-commit</path>
  </file>
  <file>
    <path>.githooks/commit-msg</path>
  </file>
</args>
</read_file>
[read_file for '.kilocode/rules/auto-commit.md', '.githooks/pre-commit', '.githooks/commit-msg'] Result:

<files>
<file><path>.kilocode/rules/auto-commit.md</path>
<content lines="1-23">
 1 | # Auto-Commit Rule
 2 | 
 3 | When a task is completed successfully, you MUST automatically commit the changes using the following convention:
 4 | 
 5 | Format: `<type>(<scope>): <description>`
 6 | 
 7 | Types:
 8 | - feat: A new feature
 9 | - fix: A bug fix
10 | - docs: Documentation only changes
11 | - style: Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code (white-space, formatting, etc)
12 | - refactor: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
13 | - perf: A code change that improves performance
14 | - test: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests
15 | - chore: Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools and libraries such as documentation generation
16 | 
17 | Example: `feat(auth): add login validation`
18 | 
19 | **Procedure:**
20 | 1. Verify all tests pass (if applicable).
21 | 2. Stage all changed files: `git add .`
22 | 3. Commit with a descriptive message: `git commit -m "type(scope): description"`
23 | 4. If the commit fails due to hooks, fix the issues and retry.
</content>
</file>
<file><path>.githooks/pre-commit</path>
<content lines="1-37">
 1 | #!/bin/bash
 2 | 
 3 | # Pre-commit hook for media-stack project
 4 | # Checks for trailing whitespace and runs shellcheck on modified .sh files
 5 | 
 6 | set -e
 7 | 
 8 | echo "Running pre-commit checks..."
 9 | 
10 | # Check for trailing whitespace
11 | echo "Checking for trailing whitespace..."
12 | if git diff --cached --check | grep -E '^\+.*\s+$'; then
13 |     echo "ERROR: Trailing whitespace found. Please remove it before committing."
14 |     echo "You can fix this with: git diff --cached --name-only | xargs sed -i 's/[[:space:]]*$//'"
15 |     exit 1
16 | fi
17 | 
18 | # Run shellcheck on modified .sh files if available
19 | if command -v shellcheck >/dev/null 2>&1; then
20 |     echo "Running shellcheck on modified .sh files..."
21 |     # Get list of modified .sh files in staging area
22 |     shell_files=$(git diff --cached --name-only --diff-filter=ACM | grep '\.sh$' || true)
23 | 
24 |     if [ -n "$shell_files" ]; then
25 |         echo "Checking files: $shell_files"
26 |         if ! echo "$shell_files" | xargs shellcheck; then
27 |             echo "ERROR: shellcheck found issues. Please fix them before committing."
28 |             exit 1
29 |         fi
30 |     else
31 |         echo "No .sh files modified, skipping shellcheck."
32 |     fi
33 | else
34 |     echo "shellcheck not found, skipping shell checks."
35 | fi
36 | 
37 | echo "Pre-commit checks passed."
</content>
</file>
<file><path>.githooks/commit-msg</path>
<content lines="1-36">
 1 | #!/bin/bash
 2 | 
 3 | # Commit message hook for media-stack project
 4 | # Enforces Conventional Commits format
 5 | 
 6 | commit_regex='^(feat|fix|docs|style|refactor|perf|test|build|ci|chore|revert)(\(.+\))?: .+$'
 7 | 
 8 | commit_msg=$(cat "$1")
 9 | 
10 | if [[ ! $commit_msg =~ $commit_regex ]]; then
11 |     echo "ERROR: Commit message does not follow Conventional Commits format."
12 |     echo ""
13 |     echo "Expected format: <type>(<scope>): <description>"
14 |     echo ""
15 |     echo "Types:"
16 |     echo "  feat:     A new feature"
17 |     echo "  fix:      A bug fix"
18 |     echo "  docs:     Documentation only changes"
19 |     echo "  style:    Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code"
20 |     echo "  refactor: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature"
21 |     echo "  perf:     A code change that improves performance"
22 |     echo "  test:     Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests"
23 |     echo "  build:    Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies"
24 |     echo "  ci:       Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts"
25 |     echo "  chore:    Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools"
26 |     echo "  revert:   Reverts a previous commit"
27 |     echo ""
28 |     echo "Examples:"
29 |     echo "  feat(auth): add login validation"
30 |     echo "  fix(parser): handle empty input correctly"
31 |     echo "  docs: update installation guide"
32 |     echo ""
33 |     exit 1
34 | fi
35 | 
36 | echo "Commit message format is valid."
</content>
</file>
</files>
